data.description: Department:SWA UniversityOur Company PromiseWe are committed to provide our Employees a stable work environment with equal opportunity for learning and personal growth. Creativity and innovation are encouraged for improving the effectiveness of Southwest Airlines. Above all, Employees will be provided the same concern, respect, and caring attitude within the organization that they are expected to share externally with every Southwest Customer.Job Description:Notice: We ask that you apply with your personal email address rather than your school email (.edu) so we can stay connected about future roles at Southwest. Be sure to attach a resume to your application. Join our dynamic Learning Technology team within the Department of SWA University as a Data Engineering Intern. We’re a close-knit team of five—three Data Analysts and two Data Engineers—who collaborate with program analysts and product owners to deliver end-to-end analytic solutions that support learning and integration initiatives. In this role, you’ll gain hands-on experience building and optimizing data pipelines, transforming raw data into actionable insights, and contributing to projects that directly impact how we learn and grow as an organization.  Additional DetailsJoin Southwest as a Summer 2026 Intern, with a 12-week internship lasting from May 19 – August 7, 2026.Pay of $23-25 per hour, corresponding with progress toward degreeStipends may be offered based on eligibility and program criteriaThe culture of Southwest Airlines means we value the camaraderie, collaboration, and innovation that occurs when we come together and interact face-to-face at our vibrant Corporate Campus. Due to the nature of this role, you would be required to work from our Dallas, TX headquarters facility during business hours (2702 Love Field Drive).Dedicate 40 hours each week (maximum of 8 hours per day) to your internship responsibilities and tasks.Receive free, unlimited space available travel privileges for yourself (taxes and fees may apply on international travel).Interns will be provided any required equipment, such as a laptop, for the internship.U.S. citizenship or current authorization to work in the U.S. required and no current or future work authorization sponsorship available.We’re committed to fair hiring practices and to making employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, military or veteran status, disability, genetic information, or other legally protected characteristics. Duties and Responsibilities The duties and responsibilities of the Data Engineering Intern may include, but are not limited to: Support testing of data pipelines and integrations (e.g., between People and Training applications, such as Workday and Cornerstone). Assist to isolate errors in data flow or transformation logic and document findings. Contribute to automating manual processes such as training assignment tracking, report generation, or data syncing between systems. Build or update dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau or Alteryx to reflect data from both LMS (eLearning Platform) systems. Document technical processes, data definitions, and system behaviors during the transition of Learning Management systems (LMS). Assist in monitoring data quality, flag duplicates or inconsistencies, and support cleanup efforts. Participate in user acceptance testing (UAT) for LMS features and reporting tools. Conduct and participate in quality control activities and provide meaningful feedback.  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Problem solving ability and strong written/verbal communication skills. Ability to understand new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision making. Experience in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Excel).  Knowledge of relational database coding languages, like SQL. Ability to work independently and willingness to function as part of a team.  Ability to coordinate multiple tasks and complete assignments with tight deadlines.  Self-starter with a high degree of autonomy and accountability in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. EducationHigh School Diploma, GED or equivalent education required   Progress towards degree, major, or minor Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, Analytics OR similar degree required.Progress towards a 4-year undergraduate degree preferred.   To be eligible, you must be currently enrolled as a full-time student (as defined by your university) at the time of application and during the internship.  At least 3 semesters remaining at the time the internship ends is preferredMinimum 2.5 cumulative GPA at the time of application.    Basic Qualifications   Must be at least 18 years of age   You must have a valid U.S. Social Security Number to complete the full hiring process    ExperiencePreferred: Familiarity with data tools such as Alteryx, Tableau, and Microsoft Office 365 applications. Preferred: Foundational understanding of relational databases and how data is structured and queried. Preferred: Hands-on experience or coursework involving SQL for data manipulation and analysis. Southwest Airlines is an Equal Opportunity Employer.Please print/save this job description because it won't be available after you apply.
requirements: Pay of $23-25 per hour, corresponding with progress toward degree

The culture of Southwest Airlines means we value the camaraderie, collaboration, and innovation that occurs when we come together and interact face-to-face at our vibrant Corporate Campus. Due to the nature of this role, you would be required to work from our Dallas, TX headquarters facility during business hours (2702 Love Field Drive).
Interns will be provided any required equipment, such as a laptop, for the internship.
U.S. citizenship or current authorization to work in the U.S. required and no current or future work authorization sponsorship available.
Self-starter with a high degree of autonomy and accountability in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
High School Diploma, GED or equivalent education required
Progress towards degree, major, or minor Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, Analytics OR similar degree required.
Progress towards a 4-year undergraduate degree preferred.
Must be at least 18 years of age
You must have a valid U.S. Social Security Number to complete the full hiring process
responsibilities: Dedicate 40 hours each week (maximum of 8 hours per day) to your internship responsibilities and tasks.
Ability to work independently and willingness to function as part of a team.
